pokerapp.scorer

Class HandRanks

  • Object
    • HandRanks

  • public class HandRanks
extends Object
    Author:
    Steve Faulmann, Ari Ghosh Represents the statistical summary of the rank_histogram of the cards in a hand. It determines how many cards of each rank are in the hand See [wiki page] for details. TODO: Ari was (maybe) going to write this key data structure up. & write a test 2013-03-06 (sdf): Simplified interface. Moved string representation to the toString method. << nice Removed aces low/high code TODO: Steve, I'd already done this?

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int countMultiple(int targetMultiple)
      Determines how many times a specified multiple appears in a hand
      int getRankOfMultiple(int numCards)
      Finds the highest rank of a given multiple numCards (i.e the number of cards with that rank in the hand) if numCards = 3 it will return the rank of the triple in the hand if there isn't a triple it throws an exception
      ReverseArrayIterator iterator()
      Factory method to create an iterator which moves backwards through the array that makes up the histogram

    • Method Detail

      • countMultiple

        public int countMultiple(int targetMultiple)
        Determines how many times a specified multiple appears in a hand
        Parameters:
        targetMultiple - the multiple e.g. 3 for three of a kind
        Returns:
        the number of multiples in the hand e.g. 2 for two pairs

      • iterator

        public ReverseArrayIterator iterator()
        Factory method to create an iterator which moves backwards through the array that makes up the histogram
        Returns:
        a ReverseArrayIterator

      • getRankOfMultiple

        public int getRankOfMultiple(int numCards)
                      throws Exception
        Finds the highest rank of a given multiple numCards (i.e the number of cards with that rank in the hand) if numCards = 3 it will return the rank of the triple in the hand if there isn't a triple it throws an exception
        Parameters:
        numCards - the multiple we are looking for in the hand
        Returns:
        the highest rank of the multiple, even when there is more than one - only applies for pairs or singles.
        Throws:
        Exception - if there is no multiple of numCards in the histogram

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
